what: Floral diversity has a positive effect on butterfly diversity. Positive correlation is the positive relationship between two variables as the movement of the variables’ is positively linked.
title: Variables
code: cor(diversity$Butterfly.Diversity, diversity$Grasshopper.Attacks) # Low Correlation #> [1] 0.3124323 ggplot(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = butterfly_diversity, y = Grasshopper.Attacks)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "blue", alpha = 0.5) + scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10() #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous y-axis #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous x-axis

what: As we have seen before, the correlation coefficient is at 0.31 falling in the range of having low correlation therefore contributing to a lack of a linear relationship. There is little to none correlation between the Butterfly Diversity and Grasshopper Attacks.
title: Variables
code: cor(diversity$Site.Area, diversity$Floral.Diversity) #positive correlation #> [1] 0.588387 ggplot(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = Site.Area, y = Floral.Diversity)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "red", alpha = 0.5) + scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10() #> Warning: Transformation introduced infinite values in continuous y-axis

what: The correlation coefficient falls at 0.58 depicting a positive correlation that there is a relationship between the site area increasing floral diversity.
title: Variables
code: cor(diversity$Site.Area, diversity$Predator.Attacks) #Positive Correlation #> [1] 0.9667945 ggplot(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = Site.Area, y = Predator.Attacks)) + geom_point(size = 3, color = "blue", alpha = 0.5) + scale_y_log10() + scale_x_log10() ggplot(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = Site.Area, y = Predator.Attacks), color = "gray", alpha = 0.5) +   geom_point(color = "gray") +   geom_point(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = Site.Area, y = Predator.Attacks), color = "red", alpha = 0.6) +   geom_smooth() + geom_smooth(data = diversity, mapping = aes(x = Site.Area, y = Predator.Attacks)) #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'
